I can now edit text in a Swing JTextArea hosted in an SWT container, but can't listen for DocumentEvents.
I've updated the org.eclipse.examples.swing.inProcessSwing example to use a DocumentListener
to track updates in the editor's contents (a JTextArea in this example). The editor itself implements
the DocumentListener interface and tries to fire a PROP_DIRTY property change event so the editor
knows its content changed. The following exception is raised on every keystroke:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access

NOTES:

This is an example of the kinds of problems people will have if they try to 
mix SWT (and JFace) and Swing. Suggest that the work being done in 
ABCEditor.insertUpdate needs to be syncExec'ed. This will allow you to detect 
what the real exception is.

The source for this example seems to be missing in the open source repository. 
Care to post it here?

There is not wrong here. It is only possible to use SWT
widgets in the right display thread. If you want to
call any method in a SWT widget from a thread that is
not the display thread, you have to Display.asyncExec/syncExec
a runnable.
